intro: Epinetrum undulatum, commonly known as the undulating sea holly, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive, undulating leaves and striking blue or purple flowers that bloom in spring. The plant thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in maritime climates. Epinetrum undulatum is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Its unique appearance makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscaping.
